summary: This is an email chain from January 2020 discussing the reimbursement for counseling sessions for an Epstein victim. The correspondence involves a Victim Program Management Unit analyst and others, focusing on whether to approve reimbursement for 7 sessions when only 6 were initially approved, and inquiring about the victim's attorney.

persons.name: Angela
persons.role: Recipient of email, possibly a colleague or contact in victim services
persons.context: Addressed in the forwarded email regarding counseling session reimbursement for an Epstein victim; the sender seeks her input on the victim's awareness and reaction.

connections.description: L is consulting with Angela regarding a victim's counseling reimbursement and their relationship with the victim.

events.title: Counseling reimbursement review
events.description: A victim of Epstein submitted a reimbursement package for 7 counseling sessions, but only 6 were initially approved, prompting internal email discussion.

keyFacts: An Epstein victim sought reimbursement for counseling sessions, submitting for 7 sessions when only 6 were approved.
Internal email correspondence from the Victim Program Management Unit discusses the reimbursement issue and seeks to understand the victim's awareness and potential reaction.
The email chain indicates the victim did not have a listed attorney at the time of the correspondence.
